o3SensorHero.title: O3 SENSOR
o3SensorHero.description: Prana Air O3 sensor is made with precision and fineness for both industrial-grade and consumer-grade safety monitoring. The sensor is based on electrochemical technology for highly reactive ozone gas.
o3SensorHero.descriptions: Advanced ozone detection for comprehensive air quality and environmental monitoring.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: The Prana Air O3 sensor is designed with great accuracy and quality for both environmental and industrial ozone monitoring. It uses electrochemical technology to detect harmful ozone (O3) gas. This sensor is small, lightweight, and affordable, making it easy to use in different monitoring and safety systems. It is durable, lasts a long time, and can be used in a variety of settings, including air quality stations, research facilities, healthcare environments, and industrial applications.

whyChooseFeatures.title: Factory Tested
whyChooseFeatures.description: Each sensor individually tested and calibrated

calibration.title: O3 Sensor Calibration Guide
calibration.description: Step-by-step calibration process to ensure accurate O3 measurements in your application.

whatIsSection.title: What is Ozone (O3)?
whatIsSection.description: Ozone (O₃) is a highly reactive gas composed of three oxygen atoms. At ground level, ozone is a harmful air pollutant that can cause respiratory problems, chest pain, and throat irritation. It is formed when nitrogen oxides (NOx) and volatile organic compounds (VOCs) react in the presence of sunlight. Ground-level ozone is a major component of smog and can worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions. However, in the upper atmosphere (stratosphere), ozone forms a protective layer that shields Earth from harmful ultraviolet radiation. Sources of ground-level ozone include vehicle emissions, industrial facilities, power plants, and chemical solvents.

lightMode.title: Electrochemical Technology
lightMode.description: The O3 sensor uses electrochemical gas sensing technology to detect ozone in the air. Our monitors use a special sensor to detect ozone (O3), a reactive gas that can be harmful to human health. This O3 sensor works using a simple chemical process. It has two key parts called electrodes and a special material that connects them. When O3 enters the sensor, a chemical reaction happens. This reaction creates a tiny electric current. The more O3 in the air, the stronger the current. By measuring this current, our sensor tells us exactly how much O3 is present. This helps in monitoring air quality and protecting people from harmful ozone exposure.

sensorChip.title: O3 Detection Module
sensorChip.description: High-performance electrochemical cell with integrated electronics for precise O3 measurement.
